Three innovative companies together under the Toggl brand you know and love.

Written by Nida
Updated over a year ago

After much work behind the scenes, we are excited to announce that Toggl will become Toggl Track on September 7, 2020! You will also notice some changes to the Toggl website and that we‚Äôve been joined by two new Toggl products - Toggl Plan and Toggl Hire.

 

We figured you might have some questions, so we‚Äôll try to clarify everything for you here, including who and what Toggl is, what‚Äôs changed (and what hasn‚Äôt), useful links, contact information, and FAQs. So let‚Äôs get into it!

Who and What is Toggl?

What‚Äôs Changed?

Useful Links and Contact Information

FAQs

Who and What is Toggl?

Toggl helps teams work better. We build beautifully simple tools that help you track your time, plan teams and projects, and hire more efficiently.

 

There are three Toggl products, each staffed by a dedicated team. They are:

 

Toggl Track, formerly known as Toggl, rebranded in September 2020. 

An effortless time-tracking tool that slots into any workflow. Because when time-tracking is easy, people can get more done. Toggl Track generates data that lets everyone know how long they spent on a job and whether it was profitable.

 

 

Toggl Plan, formerly known as Teamweek, rebranded in February 2020.

A beautifully simple project planning tool. Its drag-and-drop interface lets everyone know who‚Äôs doing what. So there‚Äôs less confusion ‚Äì and better productivity.

 

 

Toggl Hire, formerly known as Hundred5, rebranded in February 2020.

 

A smart pre-employment testing tool. Its skills tests help you quickly identify the strongest candidates for the job without sifting through resumes. Busy teams can shortlist quality applicants faster and fairer than ever.

 

Please note: your accounts are not linked even if you use multiple Toggl tools. Your existing login details for each tool will remain the same and continue working as usual. You cannot use your login details for one tool to access another tool. You‚Äôll need to make a new account for each tool you want to use.

 

What‚Äôs Changed?

Most changes are just aesthetic. The products are still the same tools that you know and love. The friendly faces within each team are all still the same, and company ownership has not changed hands.

 

That being said, there are a few changes to note, particularly concerning Toggl Track.

Toggl.com will be a shared homepage, referring to all three Toggl products. Beginning September 7, 2020, you can find Track-specific information at https://toggl.com/track/.

Toggl Track‚Äôs support team email changed from support@toggl.com to support@track.toggl.com

Toggl Track‚Äôs login URL changed from toggl.com/app to toggl.com/track/login/.

Job vacancies for all three companies can be found at https://toggl.com/jobs/

Useful Links and Contact Information
Toggl Track

Website homepage: https://toggl.com/track/

Login URL: https://toggl.com/track/login/

Support address: support@track.toggl.com

 

Toggl Plan

Website homepage: https://toggl.com/plan/

Login URL: https://plan.toggl.com/#signin

Support address: support@plan.toggl.com

 

Toggl Hire

Website homepage: https://toggl.com/hire/

Login URL: https://hire.toggl.com/admin

Support address: support@hire.toggl.com

 

FAQs

Can I use one login to access all Toggl products?

No. Accounts for each Toggl product are separate.

 

You can log in at:

 

Toggl Track: https://toggl.com/track/login

Toggl Plan: https://plan.toggl.com/#signin

Toggl Hire: https://hire.toggl.com/admin

 

If you ever have trouble logging in, don‚Äôt hesitate to contact the relevant support team. We‚Äôll be happy to assist!

 

Toggl Track Support: support@track.toggl.com

Toggl Plan Support: support@plan.toggl.com

Toggl Hire Support: support@hire.toggl.com

 

Is there a discount available for using multiple Toggl tools?

If you‚Äôre a large team looking to onboard 100+ users to multiple products, please discuss your interest in using more than one Toggl Tool by completing our demo request form. A team member will follow up to discuss your specific use case.

 

Are there integrations between Toggl tools?

Yes. You can connect Plan and Track using the following integration. The integration is powered by Toggl Plan and requires a paid account to work.

 

Alternatively, you can use the Toggl Track and Toggl Plan Chrome extensions to quickly start tracking your time or add a task to Toggl Plan, respectively, from anywhere on the web. For example, you could use the Toggl Track extension to start tracking time from inside a Toggl Plan task or measure how long you spend reviewing candidates in Toggl Hire.

 

Learn more about the Toggl Track browser extension.

 

Learn more about the Toggl Plan browser extension.

 

Need more help or have suggestions for improvements? Contact our support team via chat using the purple chat button in the bottom-right corner.

Join the course and begin digitally painting today!

Do you want to learn how to¬†digitally paint beautiful, accurate, and interestingly lit paintings? Or maybe you‚Äôre wanting to brush up on what you already know? Perhaps you're a complete beginner and are looking for someplace to start.¬†In any case you‚Äôve come to the right place.

The 'Digitally Painting Light and Color: Amateur to Master' course¬†will show you how to create beautiful and believable¬†paintings¬†that will stand up as professional work. The techniques taught in this course can be translated into any program from Photoshop to Procreate.¬†This course will teach you how to understand and accurately paint light and keep you from getting muddy and dull color palettes.¬†- or your money back!

This¬†course is your track to building a solid portfolio of realistic digital paintings¬†and¬†concept art! Whether for your own portfolio¬†or for client work.

This course will take you from having little knowledge in how to interpret light and apply it to your painting¬†in as little as one week.

So what else is in it for you?

You‚Äôll be taken from basic fundamentals¬†to believable and beautifully lit¬†paintings, from beginner to expert

You‚Äôll gain instant access to all¬†of the course and you'll be able to view it for life.¬†You can follow along and view each lecture or use it as a guide book to refer too when you need to brush up on a specific topic.

The course is setup to quickly take you through step by step, the process of creating beautiful colors palettes and accurate lighting. It will equip you with the knowledge to create stunning images and concept art!

This all comes under one convenient easy to use platform. Plus you will get fast, friendly, responsive support on the Udemy Q&A section of the course or direct message. Plus there are over 5 hours of content with 20 downloadable files! You could say this course is pretty lit (pun intended).

I will be here for you¬†every step of the way!

So what are you waiting for? Sign up now to¬†start creating today!

drawing environments and painting from imagination
–û–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ

The Complete Environment Painting Super Course will give you a total introduction to digital painting landscapes and environments. Or your money back.




Throughout this course, you‚Äôll be taught the art and design skills you always wanted to learn. Whether you‚Äôre just learning as a hobbyist, or you plan on becoming a professional digital illustrator or concept artist. This is the perfect course for you.




Throughout this course you‚Äôll be going through over 13 hours of live narrated content, over 30 lectures, and 55 downloadable resources. First I‚Äôll be bringing you through the very basics of perspective, then shading and rendering, and finally drawing and painting your very own beautiful scenes and backgrounds from scratch.

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll get in this course:

Instant access to all 30 lectures, in 7 sections.

over 13 hours of live, narrated content where I‚Äôll be bringing you through every step in real time.

Full money back guarantee within 30 days of purchasing the course!




The course is laid out in an easy to understand format:

First I‚Äôll be teaching you the fundamentals of perspective. We‚Äôll go through 1 and 2 point perspective, offering the same assignments that I had when I was a student in some of the top design schools.

After that, I‚Äôll be teaching you the importance of lighting and how to shade and render the basic elements that create everything. Spheres, Cubes, Cones, and Cylinders. These are the elements that make up almost everything around us.

Next you‚Äôll be learning about color theory and which colors to choose for your shadows and lights. Color is an essential part of establishing the mood in a painting.

After this you‚Äôll be combining the basic forms in order to bring what we‚Äôve learned so far together and make some recognizable scenes.

Next we move on to jumping straight into building our first scene. You‚Äôll start by drawing out a line work and setting up the perspective exactly how I taught you in the perspective lessons. We‚Äôll focus on composition and object placement to make the most of the space in our canvas. Focusing heavily on setting up our image to achieve a feeling of depth, which is one of the most important things in environment painting.

After this we refine the sketch to further enhance the idea. Redrawing it and making sure all of our elements are in place before painting.

Next we‚Äôll begin by roughly painting the main colors in. Figuring out what color everything is as well as how things change color the further they get away. Applying what we learned earlier in the color theory into some real painting situations.

Lastly after we get the main elements of our painting established. Our colors in place, and everything set up. We‚Äôll start detailing the painting and adding all the little elements that bring the painting to life. Painting grass, wood, fencing and trees.

In the next session we‚Äôll do another line work. Starting rough and working cleaner. I‚Äôll teach you to draw on top of a 3 point perspective grid.

This painting will be started by first finding all of our shadows before we start with colors. It‚Äôs important to know our shadows and lighting before we start adding details.

After this the next few hours are spent adding tons and tons of detail. I‚Äôll be explaining how high detail images are really just a series of decisions made over and over and is actually quite simple. By the end of this section you‚Äôll be a master of detail!







Throughout this entire course you‚Äôll be learning:

How to use perspective and understand it

How to choose great and lively colors

How to render and shade objects realistically

Starting a sketch

Finishing a sketch

Starting a painting

finishing a painting

adding lots of details

tips and tricks on painting, drawing, environments, etc

tons of live narrated drawing

over 50 downloadable resources!







Other Benefits:

You‚Äôll also be getting access to the Q&A section

Lifetime access to all the course material.

Contact with me, your instructor

Sign up today and take the next step to growing as an artist!

Colton Dubell
Concept Artist - Full Time Mentor!

My name is Colton Dubell, I'm a concept artist in the game industry. I¬†have a huge passion for teaching and sharing knowledge, and think that quality education should and can be both affordable and very high quality. It's my belief that anyone who has the determination and patience to become an amazing artist can absolutely do it!

My work experience as a concept artist includes working in the video¬†game industry, in addition to AAA video games I‚Äôve been a designer on mobile games and several¬†theme park projects.

I¬†graduated from FZD School of Design in Singapore and also attended Art Center College of Design in Pasadena¬†California for a year before quitting to work full time as a designer.

Concept Artist and Illustrator

A ¬† C R E A T I V E

I'm Austin Batchelor. I'm a working professional creative in the game industry. I work as a concept artist and freelance illustrator. I've worked in-house at an animation studio but currently, work from home. As an instructor, I strive to provide the best learning experience possible for my students by creating clear content and maintaining a personable demeanor.
